title: Rate of reduction of NO by H2

content.description: <math alttext="2 N O gas plus 2 H 2 gas produces N 2 gas plus 2 H 2 O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Trial Initial Concentrationof <math alttext="N O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="Molar " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> Initial Concentration of <math alttext="H 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="Molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> Initial Rate of Formation of <math alttext="N 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="Molarity per second " overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> 1 0.10 0.10 <math alttext="1.2 times 10 to the negative 3 power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> 2 0.10 0.20 <math alttext="2.4 times 10 to the negative 3 power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> The information in the data table above represents two different trials for an experiment to study the rate of the reaction between <math alttext="N O gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 2 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, as represented by the balanced equation above the table. Which of the following statements provides the correct explanation for why the initial rate of formation of <math alttext="N 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater in trial 2 than in trial 1? Assume that each trial is carried out at the same constant temperature.

choices.label: The activation energy of the reaction is smaller in trial 2 than it is in trial 1.
The frequency of collisions between reactant molecules is greater in trial 2 than it is in trial 1.
The value of the rate constant for the reaction is smaller in trial 2 than it is in trial 1.
The value of the rate constant for the reaction is greater in trial 2 than it is in trial 1.

content.answer: The frequency of collisions between reactant molecules is greater in trial 2 than it is in trial 1.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
